reviews.reviewText: Product was super easy to setup with the app. The app has poor reviews, but this is due to people not reading the instructions. You need to click "register" instead of trying to login immediately. That's how you create your username and password. The video works great to watch live, both in daylight and at nighttime. reviews.reviewTitle: Easy Setup. Good Picture Quality. App Controls Everything
reviews.reviewText: This HeimVision is a nice security camera but it could also be used as a baby monitor, Nanny cam, pet monitor, or to check on an elderly family member. Included in the box are the camera, user manual, mount & screws, and power adapter & cable. Some of the features are night vision, 2-way audio, intelligent tracking, and motion detection. It can also tilt and pan and is easy to control within the app. The camera panning and tilting are almost completely silent. It also has 4x digital zoom. It also works with Amazon Alexa but you need something with a screen such as the Echo Show. I’m just using the camera through an app on my iPhone and iPad. The camera has 1080p resolution and can support up to a 128GB micro SD card. The files are saved as mp4 files. Cloud service is also available but there is an extra cost for it. The camera also has a wide angle lens so you’re able to see the majority of a room. The Infrared night vision is capable of about 35 feet. Setup is very quick and easy. You download an app via a QR code on the box to your phone or device. Once the app is installed, you install the camera via a QR code within the app. The entire process was less than 5 minutes. You have to use a 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi connection. Once installed, you can view from anywhere. The 2-way audio works really well and is pretty clear but I have noticed the sound coming out of the camera is better than the sound coming out of the app. Another feature I like is the ability to set presets so that you don’t have to manually scan to different areas of the room. You can also take manual snapshots or manually record video. You can also add multiple cameras and view/control them through a single app. There are several options within the app to control night vision, sound, tracking, etc. Overall, it’s a very good camera especially considering the price.

For those looking for a good all-around security solution for their home, this camera is a pretty solid choice. Some of the things that I really enjoy about it are:
- it has motion tracking! This is actually pretty cool… Once at a text motion it will begin to follow you around the house. Is it perfect, no. It will sometimes lose you as you’re moving. But the fact of the camera sitting there turning and following you at all is creepy cool and definitely feels like a deterrent to anyone who comes into your house.
- it has an alarm! This is also one of the things that I really did want for my home security. I would rather deterrent than getting alerted and just being able to watch somebody rob my house. This camera has the option of sounding an alarm when it detects motion.
- it has a local storage option. For those who don’t want to pay for cloud storage, it does have local storage using a microSD card.
- it sends alerts to your phone. Setting it to motion detection, the camera will send you an alert when it detects motion.

What I don’t like:
- notifications are sketchy. Sometimes I don’t receive any notification when it detects motion. Sometimes I receive a notification when, for the life of me, I have no idea what it detected!
- The playback feature is stupid. It’s possible that I am the one who stupid, but the playback feature is not the most intuitive. It basically opens up a timeline and shows highlighted the sections where it began to record as it detected motion. This is for the ST play back. Maybe cloud storage is a little better and it will actually record the events separately.
- panning up and down is limited. I actually wanted to install this thing sticking out of the wall. However, the “ball“ of the camera can’t pan up and down all the way. As you reach it’s maximum limit upward, panning left or right ends up panning in an ark, making the type of installation that I wanted not practical.

What I’m “meh” about:
- you can talk through the camera - The audio for features like this is never very good. And I feel that it’s pretty much the same with this camera. My Kuna is MUCH better in this regard.

Overall- I’m glad I got this camera. Whether I receive the notifications every single time or not, the camera did detect motion consistently. If you have it set to sound an alarm, even if you don’t receive a notification, I feel that would be enough of a deterrent to send any intruders running. That said, I received notifications accurately probably 90% of the time.

I see that the older models had some issues with the app that you need to use with it, but with this new model, I have not had a single issue on my S8+. reviews.reviewTitle: It works flawlessly recording 24/7 to SD or the Cloud and Easy to install.
reviews.reviewText: I received my HM205 camera kit today. In only 2 hours I had the system up and running. One delay is I didn't know how far 20cm was so I held the bar code much too close to the camera. The voice prompts worked perfectly telling me what it was doing and it's status. The image is very impressive and I was able to move the camera nearly 30ft away from the router to a front entrance and it works just as well as when within a few feet of the router. Impressive as we have steel studs in our modern home. It is working flawlessly and I will spend more time hooking it up to Alexa than it took me to get it working thru my smart phone. A real bargain. Costs 1/2 what the RING does and thieves cannot just rip it off the outside wall. Provides very good image even thru a window screen. I'll be getting another one for the back of the house.

There are many pro's to this security camera: night vision, time stamp, easy set up, control with finger tip on your phone or smart tablet. The best feature is the two way audio. My husband was out of town and received a notification when we got home. He was able to say hello to our daughter. She was so excited to hear his voice. I highly recommend this security camera.

Purchased for my single, young daughter for her personal home security and so she can keep an eye on her Dog when she is away. The price, 2 way audio, night vision, & ability to view from an app were the selling points. It was easy to set up and the app works wonderfully. Anything more than 3 days of tape you have to pay for, but that is pretty reasonable.

It’s new, but so far so great. We will update our review later. The photo provided is a screenshot from the app. You can make the pic bigger, and turn your phone, but you won’t see the details and the option to use the microphone will go away. Some of that isn’t necessary every time of course.

The notification of movement are a little much with a dog at home, but you can adjust those as well 😁

Right out of the box it was breeze to setup. The app is simple to use and easy to understand. The camera connects to your WiFi right through app. The 2 way audio is loud, crisp and clear from both the camera and through the app. The video and still shots are clear. I like that as soon as motion is detected get a notification sent to my phone, I can also take snapshots of video. I put one camera in my son's room to check on him throughout the night. It swivels all over, allowing me to see his whole room. I can keep an eye on the kids whenever I go to the grocery store or if we're not home I can make sure the house is safe and secure. I set up the motion detect and within seconds my phone will notify me. Click on the notification and it takes you straight to videos to see what happened. Downloading the video to your phone was just a click of button. You can also take pictures through the app. There are many ways to utilize the camera through the app. You can scan using the controls in the app, take a 360 picture, speak through the camera, and even zoom.

So far so good! Set up was very easy! We have a router with both 2.4 and 5Hz WiFi and it still works!

It can lag but I’m not using it for a security camera, just to watch my dogs. I did not have to type in anything, scanning the codes worked just fine with my phone.
I would highly recommend it!

reviews.reviewTitle: Works great to watch my dog while I'm at work!
reviews.reviewText: We recently adopted a dog and I hate having a crate in the house so I bought this camera so I could monitor her while we were gone! I've caught her doing things she shouldn't be doing and she can hear me over the speaker when I tell her "NO" or "STOP," which is exactly what we needed it for. The motion detector is super sensitive. I swear nothing happens and I get a motion notification. My boyfriend, the dog, and I have all been out of the house and I've received motion notification and when I check there's nothing there. The camera is also perfect for the limited space that we have. My apartment runs from front door straight back to the bathroom door so I'm able to position the camera in various positions without have much blindspots.

reviews.reviewTitle: Good wifi camera for the money
reviews.reviewText:
This wifi webcame is surprisingly jam packed with features. Full 360 degree control from you phone with two way audio.

Package/set up: Camera comes with power cable and mounting screws. Set up was an easy 3-4 steps following instructions. I didn't really have any issue getting the camera going.

Video: HD lagged on my internet service. 1 button click to standard definition helped the streaming significantly.

Audio: hearing over the camera to your phone is a decent quality. Transmitting voice from your phone to the camera is adequate.

Storage: current options are SD card that the buyer will have to add to the camera. Or pay for a cloud service to store the camera footage. Video and pictures can also be saved live stream to your viewing device.

Motion detection: pretty spot on. Notifications were sent to my phone when the motion sensor picked up movement.

Nightvision: worked rather well in dark areas.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great Camera, especially for the Price
reviews.reviewText: The camera is very easy to use with superb quality and 360° views, which I love. I can access the camera anytime with the app interface that is simple and easy to use. I also appreciate Alexa compatibility. I watched videos online aid my decision making, and I cannot be happier with this camera. I have a very expensive outdoor security system that I wish worked as well and consistently as my two HeimVison cams. It’s loaded with feature that I would think might only come with a more expensive cam. I’m happy with the night vision and the motion detection, and even the 2-way audio is decent. The online videos seemed to suggest the 2-way audio was weak, but I’ve found it to be pretty good, better than a fancy smart doorbell that I have. I have yet to figure out the microSD storage but hope to get that up and going soon. All in all, I cannot be happier with this camera, as I have said. I’ve paid 4-times as much and feel like I’ve gotten less of a camera.

This camera did meet my expectation. The installation was easy. In my home I use to watch the dogs. Following the step-by-step instruction, I was able to set it up fairly quickly. I really like the video recording. Motion detection is great. You can set device notification so that you can be notified when someone is in your house. Recordings can be stored in the cloud for free in the first 30 days. And it supports local storage by micro SD card up to 128 GB. All in all, the camera did meet my expectation, I would recommend this product to friends and family.

It came with a 30-day cloud trial to store all of the videos, but I ended up buying 128GB miniSD cards to avoid paying a monthly charge on four cameras. The video quality can switch from standard to HD with a click on the app. Sometimes the app can respond slowly when controlling the camera on HD mode. But the picture looks incredible. I love how it pans and tilts through the app. It’s also cool that it links to Alexa and I can tell “Alexa, show me the garage” and it streams the garage camera onto my tv. I can’t say enough about how great these cameras are so far. It’s only the first week of use though. So I’ll update if anything breaks or doesn’t work correctly down the road.

reviews.reviewTitle: A Camera That Just Works at a Good Price
reviews.reviewText:
The price was right. The picture quality is excellent (though I can't figure out why, sometimes, it's monochromatic rather than color). I like the wide angle. I like that we can remotely reposition the camera and can check it anywhere we have an internet connection. There are a few things that prevent this from being a 5-star camera — these are more annoying than serious flaws:
1. Occasionally, the app just freezes and we have to quit and restart the app.
2. Every few days, the cameral loses its connection to our router.
3. It's hit-or-miss on the camera recognizing the QR code to reconnect it to the router. That technology works extremely well in other applications (for example, my iPhone recognizes and reads a QR code very, very quickly), but is **VERY** tricky with this camera.
4. The voice prompts when rebooting and reconnecting the camera to the router are annoyingly loud

I wish that there was at least a free online storage account for a few days of video.

I tried using the QR code, the AP mode, 15 times with the camera next to the router. I have 2.4ghz wifi, so it wasn't that. I have plenty of devices connected with no issues. This failed every single time. Extremely frustrating. Would not recommend.

I can't believe all of these reviews that setup was "so easy." I'm having The Worst time. Unit just keeps repeating "wait for a connection" The video Guide within the app doesn't even play on my phone. I have a dual band router and went through the whole process of disabling 5ghz to make this work on 2.4-- not even a hint that it was ever going to work. I'm very very very skeptical of the other reviews.

reviews.reviewTitle: Well I liked it while it still worked
reviews.reviewText: I had this camera less than a week and it stopped working. When you plug it in and it powers on, you are supposed to hear a voice. Well, I stopped hearing the voice and the red lights stopped coming on. I could not get it reconnected to the wifi either. I tried different cords as well as a different plug. Maybe I just got a dud but I will be returning it.

I was really excited about this item. The box showed a lot of features that would be perfect for daily use. I carefully read the set up instructions. I could not connect to wifi after trying for a whole hour. It suggested that the phone and camera be placed as close as possible to my router. I had the camerasitting ON TOP of the router and it still would not connect. Never got it to go any further because of this defect

I'm a father of two kids and i have two cats one dog, my little girl is just 6 month.I bought this wifi camera to keep an eye on my families while I’m at work. I’m always work too late cuz i am designer.The package include a camera, user manual, mount & screws, and power adapter & cable, very easy to install just follow the instruction,the features of night vision, 2-way audio, intelligent tracking, and motion detection has exceeded my expectations,I can also talk to them at anytime anywhere,especially the motion detection trigger email alert make my families safer even in the night. I like being able to pan, tilt, and zoom with the app,I’m just using the camera through an app on my iPhone and iPad and the night vision still provide a clear image in the evening,the motion sensor is sensitive for detected car passed by, this make me very happy.
Overall this camera has worked really well for me and what I need it for. It's packed full of lots of features and does everything it advertises really well. Works great with your phone from anywhere and the video quality is pretty impressive and detailed as well. It's also at a great price for the quality. Highly recommend.

The instructions are misleading. When setting up it tells you to point to the QR code until it is clear and then move closer or farther until you hear the sound. So, like most other set ups you would point your PHONE at the QR code on the camera but the phone's camera never turns on so you can't line up the the very small QR code on the device. But, a QR code does display on your phone and you're suppose to point the CAMERA at your phone. Since there's no screen on the camera how can you point it at the QR code until it is clear? Other than that the camera seems to be working fine.

The camera worked fine for about a week. After that motion sensor quit working . At least that’s what I believe is going on. Red lights around edges stopped working and motion sensor alerts stopped coming to my phone. I’ve tried resetting device , rebooting device via the app and removing completely and reinstalling device. None of these options worked. I also contacted customer service but haven’t heard from them yet. Possibly some one knows of a fix for this problem if so it would be greatly appreciated. I bought this device for my dog that has seizures and the motion sensor is critical to help me keep an eye on her. As stated above it worked fine for a week so possibly it’s something i did with app although I’m very savvy with software and computers and I have checked all settings that may pertain to this problem but haven’t had any luck fixing. It may be a hardware issue. Please help

I purchased 2 of these cameras a few months back to replace my sons baby cam, as well as the living room cam. So I have previous experience with this exact model. Other than the occasional loss of connection and the annoyance of constant messages about signing up for the subscription service, (Which is not necessary for recording to an SD card).; the only real problem I have with this device is the fact that you can't watch live continuously without having to "resume" your viewing session. I use it primarily to watch my toddler son sleep and it's annoying having to resume each session while your sleeping and the audio would alert you to him waking up. Other than those issues, which could be improved with Developer updates... I recommend this camera for an affordable home security/baby cam.

*UPDATE* The humanoid detection needs some work. I left the house one day and received an alert that a human was detected and my heart dropped. It ended up just being my dog. Disabled the function and continue to receive similar alerts... Over all, the camera is small and compact. The clarity of the video is pretty good. Glad I purchased this camera.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great value for the price, but lacking in useful features.
reviews.reviewText:
The devices were easy to hook up and have a good picture quality. The night vision distance is a bit limited, but they seem good otherwise.

The downside to the cameras is there is no sound notifications within the app or on Alexa. We bought these as baby monitors and they are pointless if we can’t hear that a child is crying.

Alexa functionality has good picture quality, but takes some time to actually connect. You also cannot control the camera via Alexa.

I ordered this to be a pet monitor while I am away but I could never get the camera to connect to my wi-fi but had not issues when connected my Heimvision HMD2. When I originally downloaded the pixplus app it had poor rating in the apple store but I figured I would try anyways. I am returning this camera and getting another HMD2 for my intro monitoring. I really did not want to spend the extra money to have 2 cameras but I now know that HMD2 works well. Another feature I do not like about the Heimvision cameras is that they all use different smartphone apps. This does not make sense to me. Its all from the same company so they should all use the same application....another reason why I just ordered a second HMD2. You also have to pay for cloud storage but thats a whole other issue

This camera was easy to hide on my kitchen window sill at the front door. So anyone entering and leaving activates the camera. It has settings to differentiate between "humanoid" and "motion detection" but I would not be bragging about that. When the cat gets on the counter it warns me that a "humanoid" was detected. Now, I love my cats but......
It is small enough that no one who has come into the house has noticed it. It films in color during the day and when the lights are off it is in black and white. It pans up and down and all around. I like being able to look at my phone to see what is going on. It is a great little camera.

Very good product for the price! I wanted a camera in my house to check in on my teen and dog when necessary as well as keep an eye on the house when I'm away. The motion detection so far is mostly good, but only when in the field of view of the camera. It does not detect sound and move the lens towards the sound- but that would be a much more advanced device. It was easy to set up and I used a micro SD card. I'm not looking for something to pay monthly or yearly for (which is offered). This does not have any sort of battery, so it needs to remain plugged in to function (not what I expected when I ordered it) so I had to alter my plan for placement of the device.

I purchased this camera in order to monitor my inside property while away from home. The setup of the camera was fairly simple and it worked as advertised. The camera does not have set points as the 203 version advertises, this would be a big plus if added. The zoom was just okay, there was a lot of distortion at the 4X setting. The two way voice was delayed and almost unrecognizable. The movement with the arrow keys does work but it is sooo slow. I was expecting a lot more since I have high speed internet. I do have other cameras and it is almost normal movement. Overall, I gave it 3-stars since it was not up with my other cameras. If you just need a simple monitoring devise this would probably work great. I did not check the night vision but I always leave light on so it should do okay. The tracking of a person was a plus. If you want to monitor your child or pet this would work great.

I put this camera in my garage so I can see why my garage doors are still open and to make sure I can close them remotely. The camera picture quality is very good in both daylight and night vision. The only issue I have is with the two way audio. When I use it, the volume seems to be low so that is hard to hear sound coming from the camera. There maybe a setting that I am missing to adjust the volume. But overall very good camera.

reviews.reviewTitle: Too sensitive to changes in light.
reviews.reviewText:
For a cheap camera it's ok. Motion tracking works well. Quick notification on the app.
Unfortunately it goes off when a light comes on or the sunlight shifts on the window. I'm sure my neighbors don't appreciate the alarm sounding every few minutes. Have changed the sensitivity to the least sensitive but it doesn't help.
There is a timer function so you can turn it off during a set time frame. Unfortunately it does not disable the alarm. I have an Echo dot and can tell it to torn on the camera, but it does not work to turn it off.
Probably going to send this back if I can find a better one.

I needed a budget video camera to see which of my cats was eliminating inappropriately. I can’t say enough about this one! It is fantastic - quick set up; clear, crisp images; and easy to use via the user-friendly app! I wish the cloud service was a bit less, we’ve had to switch to checking the SD card when reviewing. Once in a while the camera disconnects, but it’s so easy to reconnect it (sometimes it does it on its own, which leads me to believe its my fiber internet, not the camera itself). My son also bought one and it’s been perfect for him as well!

I bought a HM211 and decided to add another camera. Price of this one was slightly cheaper than the HM211 but not by much and I figured that was just due to the durability and additional antenna on the HM211. Nope.
This HM205 is junk. The image quality is horrible, and it can't see anything in low light.
The HM211 was so great in low light that it can see in the dark with the street lights. The HM205 can't see anything even with a light right in front of it. Terrible image sensor quality and must have like a f4 or higher aperture.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great camera for its price; nice features; average streaming speed
reviews.reviewText: I paid $30 for this camera; and I can say for its price its a great camera. Night vision really impressed me. In full darkness I'm able to see my living room and balcony very clear. The motion detection works as expected. You can receive a notification right away after the camera detects any motion; very fast response in that part. The video quality its pretty good; the optical zoom also is good. The camera rotates 360 degrees; so I put the camera at the top of my front door in which it has a crystal panel; I can see outside and it can rotate completely and I can see also my living room. It has presets so you can set and save different spots thats very nice. It has an alarm also in which you can enable if you want; Remotely you can speak by using the app no matter where you are and audio sounds right away loud and clear. My only concern is the streaming; its a bit slow when you want to see a recorded video that is on the cloud. You can set it with 2 options; to record it 24hr constantly or to record only when a motion is detected. Using the app you can see when a motion was detected and go straight to that part of the video and verify whats happening; the only drawback its that its not so fast; even that I have a 150MBps download / 15Mbps upload internet service. Another thing is that streaming is free just the 1st month; after that then you have to pay if $7 for 24hr record service or $5 for only when motion is detected. You can opt to use an SD card but you CANT access remotely the SD Card to check your videos; you have to remove the SD card from the camera; so sad that you cant access the SD card remotely. I hope HeimVision improves the streaming service to me faster then it would be an excellent camera. I highly recommend this camera for low budget buyers. Its the best low budget camera you can get.

reviews.reviewTitle: Really should come with micro SD card
reviews.reviewText: The camera is fine. Extremely easy to set-up. They aren't kidding when they tell you to be near your router. It is a different app (PIXPLUS) than the battery powered camera HMD2 (HeimVision app) and that is really annoying and not disclosed until you get the camera home. The sensitivity is fine. Not the most outstanding picture. They really need to include the micro SD card. I happened to have a couple floating around the house so I can go back and view history on the app. Gotta have. I do not have the cloud service.

Very good camera. It delivers clearer HD images than those of 720P. I setup the camera to auto tracking and I use it to check what the cat does when alone at home. Detection sensitivity, off time period and sending time for notifications, the period & frequency, can be set as you wish and I really appreciate it. Up to 10 meters the night vision in low light provides a clear image. I would like it to have a longer range (15-18 m). I did not use the cloud service but a SD card. Great product! I like it so much, therefore I will purchase 2 more. It works on 110-220V .

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn't have a stable connection and sound quality is poor
reviews.reviewText: I've have been using this camera for about 2 months now. At first, the camera seemed okay. Everything was working like it should. However, about a month into using this product, I began to experience issues. The camera's video quality is okay but it constantly drops the connection. 1 in 5 times when I check the camera, it says "offline." I have to unplug it and plug it back in for it to reboot. I tried doing a device reboot from the app but it didn't do anything. Also, the sound quality is not good. I have to turn my phone volume all the way up before I start to hear anything. When talking, there is a lag. I see the person's mouth moving, but the voice lags. It's almost like watching an old martial arts movie. I would not recommend this product.

UPDATE: this camera worked a month then it continued to crash, and the app stopped supporting my WiFi. Completely waste of money!!
I purchased this can on prime day, so I got a good deal. The picture quality is blotchy and the color is very faded. It also has a delayed alert for motion. I gave this camera a 4 because it's able to pick up motion and follow the source, as well as the night vision is good. I personally wouldn't use this as a primary security camera, due to the delays and quality.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy set up picture quality is good for price.
reviews.reviewText: The set up for the camera was beyond easy. It took less than ten minutes. Next, I was impressed with the camera’s ability to stay connected even in areas with a weak WiFi connection. Currently I am using it to keep an eye on my new axolotl. I have found that even though the room gets not an incredible amount of sunlight, at almost all times, the camera remains in night mode which is rather annoying as it diminishes the picture. I would recommend but I would say it is better in light than dark. Good buy for the money.

reviews.reviewTitle: Was better until they 'updated' the app
reviews.reviewText:
Was much better until they 'updated' the app. Used to go landscape by merely turning the phone sideways either clockwise or counter clockwise, now you must hit an icon, then it only goes landscape in one direction, counter clockwise. This is a pain when the plug is attached from the left.
Also, it has dropped signal numerous times since updating the app. I had to come home to reboot. Not what I want when monitoring things at home.
Had to return.

reviews.reviewTitle: HAVING A REAL PROBLEM WITH APP/WIFI /CAMERA CONNECTION
reviews.reviewText: I AM HAVING THE WORSE TIME WITH THE APP ON MY IPHONE-- I CANNOT GET A CONNECTION FROM CAMERA TO WIF-- THE STARTER GUIDE VIDEO WILL NOT LOAD--- I BOUGHT TWO OF THESE CAMERAS THINKING I WOULD BE ABLE TO INSTALL OUTSIDE -- NOT POSSIBLE. I WILL HAVE TO SIT THEM ON THE INSIDE WINDOW SILL --IF I EVER GET A CONNECTION. I WILL GIVE A REVIEW--IF I EVER GET INSTALLED.

reviews.reviewTitle: Incredible product for an even more impressive price
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Heimvision camera and it is better than the first one which was the HM203 model. I use them mainly to watch my son while he is napping and home security. I 100% recommend this camera!! The are inexpensive and there are settings in the app where you can have it record any time a sound or motion is detected without subscribing to the cloud (which is easier but I don't have the money to spare). I use a 128GB Class 10 micro SD card and everything is stored there.

reviews.reviewTitle: Do Not Buy - Amazing in one way....What complete garbage it is.
reviews.reviewText:
Besides the camera being the slowest camera I've ever had experience with when moving it up/down & left/right.
On top of that, (at least without a subscription, The thing never detects motion and thusly never alerts me.
As to subscription, if this company thinks that I am going to PAY FOR A subscription , they NEED TO RETHINK THEIR BUSINESS MODEL.
I've read the direction. I found it easy to setup. It is simply a garbage device that Amazon will be getting back.

reviews.reviewTitle: Heimvision HM205 Camera is a very good quailty item
reviews.reviewText: The Heimvision HM205 1080P Security Camera is just what we needed. It came to us in a timely manner and was packaged very well. We plan to use it in our RV and at home when we are not traveling in our RV. Our main reason for purchasing it to what our 3 dogs. I set it up today in our RV and I was amazed at how easy it was to setup and how well it functions. The video is clear and flows perectly. I highly recommend it.

It's pretty incredible what you can get for such low prices these days. I purchased this camera for a friend with a special needs child. My friend was extremely happy with the motion detection in the hallway viewing the staircase. he showed me how he could check in on his son and warn him if he were getting into something he shouldn't. For the cost, I would certainly recommend this for a Wifi camera application.

reviews.reviewTitle: Easy to use app with camera!
reviews.reviewText: Easy to use app on the phone (picture included) able to preset angles of the camera to see certain common areas with your camera so you don’t have to joystick the image all the time. Sound to talk through the camera isn’t the greatest, but we don’t use that feature anyway. Sometimes false always movement when sun intensity changes in the day, but rather over detect than under detect! So far, very happy with this camera.

This camera has a great picture and really works well for me to check on my aging dog while I am at work. The set up was a little difficult for me but due to no fault of the camera. It runs on 2.4GHz and we usually use 5 so getting this to connect to the 2.4 was not an easy task. Once we figured it out though it was incredibly easy. My daughter loves talking to the dogs through it and we can check on them anywhere. I would highly recommend this camera!

Works as advertised at a great price. Picture quality is excellent and you can zoom and pan using the touch screen on your device. Sometimes you need to relaunch the program for the camera to go live (not a big deal) and lots of prompts to purchase cloud storage for video recording. So far so good. Haven't really tested motion detection, but settings available for motion sensitivity. Recommended for basic security to keep an eye on the house.

reviews.reviewTitle: Simple to setup, easy app to use and quality is good
reviews.reviewText:
You can switch between SD and HD quality and it does make a difference.
Images are from three scenarios, with light, only monitor light, and lights out respectively.
For the price I paid, the camera is well worth it and comparable with more expensive camera.

As for the automatic detection feature, it is a hit or miss for me.. sometimes it is too aggressive and when the room is quite you can make out the cameras motor adjusting the camera.

And the quality image when it is all dark is abit washed when I compare to my Mi 360 HD camera.

For now, the basic features works for me and I use the SD card for storage and not the cloud (you have a special offer if you want to opt for that option).

Will leave feature update after using this for a while.

Pain in the butt to setup but finally had it working. Woke up after first night to a message that the camera was disconnected. Would not turn on after that. Picture quality is NOT 1080! Spend a few more dollars for a better product.

I was looking for a security camera that can notify me when my kids leave for school and arrive home safely. After researching on the best and affordable camera this was the one I decided i was going to try out and if it wasn't what I expected i could simply return it. But to honest, i have no regrets! Easy to install, Easy to understand. Night vision is awesome. The human intelligence detection on point. I am notified when the outside camera detects anything going in and out my front door. With its 360° turning smart camera, it can record and pick up any movements outside with its motion sensored features. I feel less worried knowing my kids arrived home safely and knowing I can watch what they're doing inside the house. Monitoring the studies and best yet, i can speak directly to them 2-way using the camera. It is very Affordable. I feel its better that the $100+ security cameras out there.

UPDATE: the company saw my review and immediately reached out to me and offered to replace my camera at no cost. They shipped it out and I got it a couple days later. Works great! Thank you so much for such excellent customer service!

Original Review (3 stars)
I got this in order to check up on my dog during the day. The image and sound are awesome - and I love the size of the camera. the one negative is the camera wont rotate more than half the time. I have had to reboot it already several times and still have these issues.

Connecting the camera to my network wasn't too bad. Using the camera through my phone worked also but, I don't stare at my phone all day like some people. Trying to connect to Alexa didn't happen. The camera is made by Heimvision but to connect to Alexa a skill called Closeli is needed. There were 15 reviews of Closeli all one star with very negative comments. The only way to view this camera is through your phone. No thanks.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great overall camera for viewing or recording when not at home!
reviews.reviewText: Great camera that serves its purpose to record and view an area when your not at home. I used it specifically to watch my kitten when she was held in a confined area of the living room to see how she was doing and what mischief she was getting into. The picture quality is quite good as well as the night vision. The ability for the camera to act as a 2 way communication device as well as nearly 360 rotate ability is great to check up on my kitten and scold her if I see her getting into any mischief. The motion detection was a bit buggy as it would constantly move and the notification system isn't that great as you get random notifications. Overall a very decent home surveillance camera!

Nice little camera for a good price! I was impressed how well it works for how much I spent. The app was easy to set up but set it up manually, don’t scan code. I like that I can see what’s going on with my kids, dogs, if I’m gone. Night vision is good too as long as there aren’t bright lights shining in the camera. Motion detection works well too.

I purchased the HM205 camera because I read the reviews and decided to take a chance. And I’m glad I did! I love this little camera. It does everything I want / need and it works so well. And the app is very easy to use. I saw some negative comments about connecting to the internet and the app but I had no problems with either. The camera works so well I purchased two more!! I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good camera at a great price!

Camera was easy to install and setup. I bought it for all the features including Alexa capability. I have used it on my Echo Show 5. It was really convenient, no need to get the phone and open the app. It has motion detection, night vision, pan/tilt, audio, notifications. The audio is good enough for my cat to get interested and knock it off the shelf :) I am happy with this camera and hope it will last a long time.

This camera came in as a whole unit ( no assembly
required ) with easy to follow instructions and once plugged in gives you prompts for easy connection. The 2 way audio is really clear and easy to understand the person speaking. The video is remarkably clear considering the affordable purchuse price. Considering buying one for my 3 year olds room as well.

reviews.reviewTitle: Low cost, high quality indoor cam, software needs an improvement
reviews.reviewText:
Using it to monitor the basement activities. It appears to be low cost but well made. Did not realize that the the iOS app on camera installation only works with iPhone and not iPad. Also, the image can only be watched on app, not on browsers like Safari. Once setup, the image is excellent and the night vision also works well on my iPhone. I especially like it’s ability to remotely control lens rotation/tilt from the iPhone app.

Update: reinstalled the app on my iPad Pro and I am able to view the image, making it a 5 star product. However, I still want to see the app a bit friendly in installation on iPad.

reviews.reviewTitle: it tracks and follows motion. nice camera
reviews.reviewText: it was really easy to setup... instruction was easy to follow. all around picture quality is really good. the motion is great, camera follows moment with intelligent tracking. speaker is nice and clear.

I purchased two of these to keep an eye on my cat who suffers from separation anxiety while I am away. They are quiet when panning and have good picture quality in both light and dark situations. I love that I can talk to her and reassure her when I can't be there with her.... much better than trying to give her medication! They are a good quality product at a good price. The only caveat is the software to for viewing doesn't work as I'd like. There is a scheduling option, but it only turns off the camera, but not back on. I have not been able to figure out how to cancel the setting so I have to turn it back on everyday.

I have other brand security cameras. Set up was easy. Picture not so great. Instruction manual doesn't describe how to use all the features. Youtube reviews are not using the current PixPlus app I have. Takes a while for the live video to show on your phone screen and there is quite a long lag compared to my other brand security cameras. Not ecstatic with this camera, but will keep.

So far very pleased with this camera. I previously had several cams from a different maker for home security and viewing but they began to lag and have spotty connection. So I have replaced them all with the HM205 and connection is great. Previous cams had slightly better image quality but these are more than acceptable and reliability has been awesome. Notifications are quick. It's great for the price.

reviews.reviewTitle: So far better than wyze camera
reviews.reviewText:
So far so good. I bought this to replace my wyze camera. That camera is too unreliable. It keeps resetting. This camera has better functions and I like the pan angles a lot more.

I wish the event recording was free for 3 days or so. I wish we could have the option to event record for certain durations like 10, 20, 30 seconds.

reviews.reviewTitle: Doesn’t use same viewing application/camera registration
reviews.reviewText: I purchased with the Heimvision wireless rechargeable devices and will have to return this wired camera. They don’t use the same viewing application. It’s the same company so why not? I find it to be an inconvenience. I also didn’t think about that each camera is charged individually for cloud space.

There are few things i am not satisfied with. Lag for 1. Notifications stopped even though its on, and its got no schedule. I cant reach the support through the app because I dont speak, chinese IDK? I only know english so I have no idea what the questions are to ask for more support. It doesnt Motion track well, and cuts off after a certain point, even though its set up to follow for a while. . The cameras does not work with black dogs, incase you have black pets to watch. The mic is useless.

We had a little trouble connecting the camera to the network but did get it done. We did lose our free month of cloud storage due to having to remove and reload the app/camera on the phone. Once we got the camera synced up it worked well. I would recommend buying this product but take the installation slow and careful. I have contacted the manufacturer to get our free month of cloud storage reinstated. I will follow up on this review when I receive word back from them.

This camera is a piece of junk. 0 stars.

The motion sensing, even when turned up to max sensitivity does not alert 100% of the time. This camera is being used to track cat litterbox issues so missing alerts is not helping my situation.

In addition to the missing motion alerts this canera disconnects from the wifi often, too often. I even bought a wifi booster to help it get enough signal; it still disconnects every couple days. And then today i couldnt get it to reconnect at all.

Not worth the lower price. Ill be searching for a better option.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great cam for the money, very user friendly.
reviews.reviewText: Super easy set up, and if you choose to use the cloud subscription, it's easy to enroll in and easy to cancel. Also extremely easy to pair with Alexa. Smooth room planning...instantly tracks where you are trying to look from the app when you drag your finger in the direction you want to look. Great camera for the money. I would suggest buying an extra long power cable if you want to mount it up high.

Picture with light is clean and clear. Night vision is not as good as my previous camera but there is no picture delay like I had on previous camera so satisfied. Setup was easy if you followed directions and received email immediately. Just received today so will update review if necessary.

Great little camera!The camera is super clear.Install was super easy too. Downloaded the app, followed the instructions and it all took about 10 minutes. I love that the camera itself can turn around and go up and down. I am probably going to get another one for in our house. I highly recommend this camera!

This is by far the best camera that I’ve purchased from amazon. I’ve tried other before but had trouble setting them up. This one was very easy to set up and it works great. I love that I can watch the video stream on my phone to keep an eye out on my dog while I’m away from home. I highly recommend this camera

This camera works well, use to watch dogs when I'm not home. Need to mount on wall or ceiling to get picture to view right side up. Can set camera for motion control and track movements. Can talk through camera if want. The only negative thing for me is the app to control camera can freeze at times. App needs improvement.

I love this product for the price I paid! I've had more problems with the ring camera than this one and I bought three for the price of one ring camera. The quality is good and with the right SD card you do not have to pay for the monitoring services. I just use my camera to watch my cats which it does very well! The only set back is that I cannot use it with my echo show and the instructions don't match up.

reviews.reviewTitle: Great cam to have and it works surprisingly well!
reviews.reviewText: Easy. Simple. Intuitive. Stylish. Reminds me of Eve from Wall-E movie in a way. lol. This is what I just needed and the value was perfect for me. I live in an apartment and as a just in case I wanted to make sure I was protected a little more. Picture quality is pretty clear. Comes packaged very nicely and protected as you see in the picture I provided and not just thrown around. I would buy another to have it look out the window for my car. Again just a little extra protection. Hehe.

Perfect for watching my animals! I elected to use an SD Card and set this device up in under 10 mins to watch my squirrels. Night vision is clear enough and app controls are easy to use. The message feature is pretty neat. I am a bit confused on Alexi interaction ad also struggled with wifi connection set up.

Set up was pretty easy but didn't have to use them until recently and they are junk. The app shows them disconnected but they were tracking me. Then the app wouldn't work and while out of town, no alerts.

Now I'm stuck with them and going with Reolink which works flawlessly.

I received this item like a week ago and I must say the install process and getting it up and running where great! We were very happy that it was able to cover my baby’s room. The best part is it has a two way speaker so u can talk through it and hear what’s going on in the room when I am not at room with my boy. The camera is very small and easy to use. I would definitely recommend to anyone.
